Description: Distribution of bread during the famine in Egypt; with buildings beyond, angels and putti above Pen and brown ink and brown wash, over graphite
Curator's comments: Three other drawings by Farina are known: two of which, also bearing old inscriptions to the artist, are in Copenhagen (GB 360 and 361; Fischer and Meyer, 2006, nos. 74 and 73). As Meyer first noted the BM drawings are projects for 'Quarantore' celebrations: the devotion in which continuous prayer is made for forty hours (quaranta ore) before the exposed Blessed Sacrament (the wafer that Catholics believe is transformed into Christ's flesh when given at communion). Lit.: J. Meyer, 'New Drawings by Luca Giordano and his Circle: Niccolò Russo, Baldassare Farina, Nicola and Oronzo Malinconico', "Paragone", 52, Series 3, 39, 2001, pp. 90-1, pl. 70; C. Fischer and J. Meyer, 'Italian Drawings in the Department of Prints and Drawings Statens Museum for Kunst, Neapolitan Drawings', Copenhagen, 2006, under no 73
